indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description:
1. Total Quantity of GHG emissions mitigated annually by End of Project (EOP), tCO2e: 196,700
2. Reduction of fuel-wood consumption for energy use in households and industries by EOP, tonnes: 183,200
3. Number of Enterprises supplying clean and efficient biomass energy systems and services by EOP: 3
4. Number of furnaces/stoves installed and used on a daily basis by households in targeted areas by EOP: 20,000
5. Number of community based fuelwood plantations being utilized by communities & households for use in BET applications by EOP: 50
6. Number of men/women trained and participating as technicians in the construction and installations of stoves: 20

location.name: Thimphu
location.activity-description: GHG reduction through NAMAs in transport and municipal sold waste and LEDS developed for transport and Industries

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: • National environmental information systems enhanced with GHG inventory and National Forest Inventory process enabled to manage forest carbon data. • 3 NAMAs (Transport, Housing and Waste management) • 2 LEDS (transport and industries) • MRV systems in place for identified NAMAs and LEDS • NEC (CCD/NEC) and Multisectoral Technical Committee on Climate Change (MSTCCC) responding adequately to national and sectoral requirements for GHG inventory, mitigation analysis and strategy development.

baseline.comment: 2nd National communication National Environment strategy NAPA update Green house gas inventory 2000

target.comment: 1. GHG inventory system enhanced through support of database development for National Forest Inventory and GHG data management framework systems 2.Identify NAMAs in transport and waste 3.In country and ex country capacity building of stakeholders for GHG, NAMAS and LEDS, MRV working group 4. Emission and mitigation scenario developed 5. Awareness and advocacy programs supported on waste and transport sector 6.Low emission development strategy developed for Industries 7. Secure additional fund for LECB enhanced support

actual.comment:
1. GHG inventory data management framework competed 1.1 Supported 24 NFI crew members on training and exposure visit to Thailand (5-10 April 2014) 1.2 2nd round of carbon assessment training conducted for over 60 NFI crews and FRMD officials from 6-9 October 2. Several rounds of consultative workshops held in identifying NAMAs in the transport and waste sector. 2.1 Decision support tools developed in the transport and waste sector. 3. Capacity building of project stakeholders supported through in country and ex country trainings and workshops
6. Initiated the work for LEDS industries through the recruitment of an international and local consultant 7. An additional USD 300,000 secured for support in the transport sector. The GNHC endorsed the project through the Project appraisal committee (PAC) meeting held on 22nd August. The TOR for the Intelligent Transport Service feasibility study has been finalized and circulated. The work is expected to start in February 2015.

target.comment:
1. Greenhouse gas inventory data management system developed 2. NAMA proposal on transport and municipal solid waste management developed 2.1 Carbon neutrality assessment completed 3. LEDS for Industries and transport developed 3.1 Vehicle emission standards revised 3.2 Awareness and advocacy on waste and transport promoted 4. Capacity building in the NAMA and LEDS process including MRVS 5. Terminal Evaluation completed LECB enhanced support
1. Support TCC in review and update of urban design and structure plans with focus on pedestranization 2. ITS feasibility study completed and key recommendations initiated 3. Support Bhutan Post in improving the current transport system 4. Institutional capacity of key stakeholders strengthened

actual.comment:
1. IC for GHG Inventory data management systems selected 2. IC consultant for NAMA transport and municipal solid waste selected and consultation process is underway to design the NAMAs 3. Work on the development of the LEDS for the industrial sector is in progress and is scheduled to be complete by June 2015. first round of stakeholder consultation completed and inception report submitted IC for LEDS transport identified 3.1 Capacity building training with focus on the validation of the tailpipe emission of vehicles provided to seven officials from the Road Safety and Transport Authority from 20-26 March 2015. The training was provided to a target group of officials who will be involved in the revision of vehicle emission standards.
LECBES 2. ITS study ongoing. Inception report submitted by IC and 2 rounds of stakeholder consultation meeting conducted on 3rd and 20th April
